csw:Record.dc:description: Individual orthorectified scenes in national map projection system (approximately 1000 scenes, 25m resolution (multispectral) and 12.5m panchromatic). Available for download. The aim of IMAGE2000 is to produce a consistent European coverage based on Orthorectified satellite imagery, necessary for the updating of the European Land Cover database (CORINE Land Cover) and for the European Spatial Reference. As a multi-purpose product, Image2000 needs to meet requirements at National and European level. According I&CLC200 product specification, Image2000 will be produced from ETM+ Landsat 7 satellite data, ortho-rectified in the national projection systems, as defined by National Administrations. In certain cases, where Landsat 7 data are not available, Landsat 5 data have been used instead. The year 2000 is targeted as reference year, but a deviation of maximum 1-year (1999 or 2001) is allowed to obtain a full coverage of Europe, which involves approximately 300 Landsat TM Frames. The Level 1 Product consists of the individual orthorectified scenes, in the national projection systems, with each scene corresponding to the relevant path/row of the Landsat sensor.
